national archives-primary source and document help your student think through primary source document for contextual understanding and to glean information to make informed judgment the first few time you ask student to work with primary source and whenever you have not worked with primary source recently be sure to model careful document analysis direct student attention to the procedure involved and the kind of question you ask about the document after several instance of modeling ask student to work a a class to analyze document vocalizing the process a they go eventually student will internalize the procedure and be able to go through these step on their own every time they encounter a primary source document remind student to practice this same careful document analysis for every primary source they see for any type of document a written document image map chart graph audio or video move through the following step before getting into the content of the document look at it in a very general sense and ask basic question consider the document s type what kind of document are we looking at for example for textual document is it a newspaper letter report for artifact what material is this made of for video is it a propaganda film cartoon training video find unique characteristic of the document which will vary depending on document type note any marking or special quality these characteristic will help student understand the document in context for example are there any symbol letterhead handwritten versus typed text stamp seal or notation is there a background color or tone are there facial expression in photograph or other telling feature is there narration or special effect is there a key attempt to identify the creator and the content of the document break down the document by asking who what where when why and how rephrase the document into plain language student should determine the content of the document and speculate for whom and why it wa created help student understand the document in historical context
